gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Emergency Facilities, Derived from HAZUS: Indiana, 2002

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: EMERGENCY_HAZUS_IN is a point shapefile that shows locations of emergency facilities in Indiana. A predecessor shapefile, named EFEMERG, was obtained by the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS). EFEMERG was included on a CD-ROM (titled HAZUS99, Central US) that is the product of a program referred to as HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses. The original shapefile has been modified by personnel of the IGS. This metadata was created by personnel of IGS, using information included in the HAZUS user's manuals. Data for the predecessor shapefile was obtained from a FEMA Database (1996) (HAZUS99, Technical and User Manuals, Appendices.pdf, Appendix D, Summary of Inventory Databases).

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The predecessor shapefile ("EFEMERG.SHP") was produced by FEMA and NIBS to serve as supplemental data for use by HAZUS, a software tool for estimating earthquake losses. That predecessor shapefile was then modified by personnel of IGS to provide a GIS layer that could be included within the GIS repository of IGS.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Please indicate HAZUS; the FEMA tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses, the National Institute of Building Sciences for the Federal Emergency Management Agency, 1997. This can be reformatted to conform with standard bibliographic citations as long as all information is included.

The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and (or) current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format, approximately 164 Kb

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the logical consistency of this shapefile. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 [attn: HAZUSHELP], email: hazushelp@durtech.com.

Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the completeness of this shapefile. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 [attn: HAZUSHELP], email: hazushelp@durtech.com.

Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the attribute accuracy of this shapefile. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 [attn: HAZUSHELP], email: hazushelp@durtech.com.

Unknown. No records exist at the Indiana Geological Survey regarding the positional accuracy of this shapefile. For more information, contact HAZUS Technical Support: ph: 800-955-9442, fax: 404-261-0117 [attn: HAZUSHELP], email: hazushelp@durtech.com.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: A shapefile named "EFEMERG.SHP" was obtained from the CD-ROM titled "HAZUS99, Central US" by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS). The shapefile was opened in ESRI ArcView. Within ESRI ArcView, the projection was set to UTM NAD83, Zone 16. The original shapefile was then converted to another shapefile (named "EMERG.SHP") by using the "Convert to Shapefile" utility of ESRI ArcView. The Table Edit function of ESRI ArcView was then used to drop the following fields: Id, state, zipcode, contact, phone, mapping, bldg_type, designlvl, bias, foundation, year_b, cost, bu_pwr, stories, num_trucks, area, capacity, kitchen, elevat, lat, long, geores, county, comment, id_.
The shapefile named "EMERG" was clipped to INCLP83, a boundary coverage for the state of Indiana (compiled at a scale of 1:24,000). The resulting shapefile was named "EMERGENCY_HAZUS_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
The data contained within EFEMERG.SHP were used to generate a shapefile named "EMERG."

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: HAZUS, The FEMA Tool for Estimating Earthquake Losses

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA); National Institute of Building Services (NIBS)
Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA); National Institute of Building Sciences (NIBS)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
